definition: to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither

sentences.english: He's never done anything injurious to morals.
sentences.chinese: 他从未做过任何伤风败俗的事。

sentences.english: Making indecent behavior inside the company. Thus, violating the law or Employment Contract.
sentences.chinese: 有违反相关法令或劳动契约之伤风败俗行为者。

sentences.english: The other half of his life seemed infinitely remote from obscenity.
sentences.chinese: 他的另一半生活好像与伤风败俗相距甚远。

sentences.english: Master Fahai thought that their marriage had violated traditional marriage and corrupted public morals.
sentences.chinese: 禅师法海认为他们的结合违反传统婚姻，伤风败俗。

definition: to have no sense of shame/brazen
disgraceful (of behavior that is unfilial, rebellious or otherwise in grave breach of the norms of society)
not according with decorum (idiom); scandalous/bad form/unacceptable behavior
worse than a beast/to behave immorally
to offend Heaven and reason (idiom); bloody atrocities that cry to heaven/outrageous acts
to drown sb in a wicker basket, a form of 沉潭[chen2 tan2]
to overstep the bounds of what is proper/to take sth too far/(of a measuring device) to go off the scale
